docs.snippet: Anger over American foreign policy, Taliban interference and isolated killings have hindered a campaign to protect the country’s children from the disease....
docs.lead_paragraph: Anger over American foreign policy, Taliban interference and isolated killings have hindered a campaign to protect the country’s children from the disease.
docs.abstract: Campaign to eradicate polio in Pakistan has been hindered by anger over American foreign policy, Taliban interference and isolated killings, as many people turn away or even kill vaccinators seeking to help children avoid the disease; Pakistan's government renews efforts to eliminate virus by hiring more vaccinators, increasing their pay, and ensuring they have police escorts in country's most dangerous areas.

headline.main: Pakistan Battles Polio, and Its People’s Mistrust
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Battles Polio, and Its People’s Mistrust
